plugins.name: Yellowstone ‚Äî¬†plugin for themes
plugins.description:
Create, switch and manage as many themes as you need.

Global themes supported, with no need to login anywhere.

Export CSS-variables from theme.

Update all styles within theme at once using Palettes.


Learn how to use this plugin with this Figma Yellowstone Playground


Switch themes üåûüåõ

Plugin switches all colors and effects within selection.

Works for texts with multiple styles.


Create new themes ‚Äî as much as you need üë®‚Äçüé®üë©‚Äçüé®

Duplicate existing theme to create new in just one click. No need to create new styles manually.


Manage themes: rename, update, delete üß∞üé®

Update themes using Palettes: draw theme‚Äôs Palette, change its colors and effects and update entire theme. Try this Figma Yellowstone Playground to learn how to use it.


Use global themes üìñ

Save your library‚Äôs themes within plugin, load it in another figma file and use. That easy. No need to login anywhere, no need to create any external files or smth.


Export CSS-variables from theme üì§

Put css-variables in styles Description once and get ready-to-go code in one click, with any update of your theme.


---


What it does with Local Styles üí°

Plugin puts square brackets in style name, to define what theme it belongs to. For example: [Light] / card, [Dark] / card or [Gray] / card.


Of course you can put brackets manually, anywhere, there's no limits: Card [Light], Card / bg [Light], Card [Light] / bg, [Light] / bg ‚Äî its all good. Also, plugin will keep your syntax renaming themes and creating new ones.

plugins.name: Presentation slides library
plugins.description:
About this plugin

deckd's presentation slides library consists of more than 270 template slides - available in dark and light mode and ready to be used in deckd. The slides are split up in 12 different categories: About (34), Agenda (16), Content (24), Facts (34), Hero (38), Overview (14), Portfolio (18), Quote (20), Team (22), Testimonial (24), Timeline (6), Value (22)


About deckd

Next gen of professional presentation creation

deckd brings structure, speed, and brand control to how enterprise teams build presentations. Without broken layouts, diluted brand, or wasted time.


Sync design with go-to-market

Design teams stay in Figma and sync design templates in one click. Go-to-market teams use those templates in deckd to create and distribute consistent, on-brand presentations with ease. Learn more

plugins.name: Vector Path Editor
plugins.description:
Select a vector object to start.


Take full control of your vector object paths with this comprehensive plugin. Edit fill rules, set first nodes, and preview changes in real-time.


Tips: If you don‚Äôt have access to your shape‚Äôs path, you need to flatten it.


Features:

  1. Edit fill rules and preview of changes (non-zero vs. even-odd)
  2. Reverse path orientations
  3. Set the first node for each path


Usage:

Select a vector object, Modify fill rules: Click on a fill to toggle between non-zero and even-odd.

Adjust path orientation: Click on a loop to reverse it (helps with hole appearance).

Set first node: Click on any node to designate it as the first (appears as a small diamond)


Benefits: Ensure compatibility with formats like TrueType fonts and Android VectorDrawable (non-zero fill rule only). Optimize designs for variable fonts (e.g., SF Symbols) by controlling first node placement. Fine-tune complex vector shapes for precise control over fill behavior.


This plugin empowers designers to manipulate vector paths with precision, improving compatibility and enabling advanced design techniques.


Acknowledgment: Special thanks to Evan Wallace for the original "Fill Rule Editor" plugin on which this work is based.


Stay Connected


For updates and more information:

Follow me on X: @Autre_planete

Contact me: AnotherPlanet.io


Support


https://github.com/thierryc/figma-fill-rule-editor/issues


Links


https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/fill-rule\

https://www.sitepoint.com/understanding-svg-fill-rule-property/

https://oreillymedia.github.io/Using_SVG/extras/ch06-fill-rule.html


This project is an open source plugins.

accepted.name: Thierry
accepted.description: I am Thierry ‚Äì a designer, developer, and, typographer based New York. I‚Äôve worked with companies large and small, building and maintaining design systems.

plugins.name: ToggleVisibleByName
plugins.description:
Prompts for a name.

Finds any layers that match that name.

Toggles those layers' visibility.


Usage example gif.


Use the quick actions bar and bring up ToggleVisibleByName. You can then start typing a layer name pattern. When you hit enter (or click on a suggestion) it will search through all of the current page's layers, find any that match your name pattern, and toggle the visibility of that layer (ie, if it was visible, it will become invisible; if it was invisible, it will become visible).


If you don't like what you see (or ... don't see!), you can run the command again with the same name to bring it back to the way it was before.


It ships with one default entry "Annotate it! ‚Äì Badge" because we are using Annotate it! (and loving it!), but wanted to be able to quickly toggle the annotation markers.

plugins.name: Swap to Local Color Variables
plugins.description:
Reassign layers bounded to external color variables to local ones of the same name in a matter of seconds.


The plugin doesn't have an interface.


How does it work:

  1. Select some layers you want to update. When nothing is selected, all layers on the page are updated.
  2. Launch the plugin. The plugin will identify color variables with matching names associated with local variables, and apply them all at once based on your selection.
  3. It will be highlighted if a layer's variables have not been updated.


--

The plugin may slow down if there are too many layers on the page. If this is the case, try selecting layers instead.

plugins.name: Lazy Export
plugins.description:
‚è∞ Version 1.1.4


Lazy export is inspired by a feature that was apart of my workflow in Sketch. I became tired of manually applying export settings across assets and projects. So this was born March 21st, locked up in my apartment.


Lazy export is inspired by a feature that was apart of my workflow in sketch. I became tired of manually applying export settings across assets and projects. So this was born March 21st, locked up in my apartment.


‚ö°Ô∏è Lazy Export allows the user to apply default export settings to selected objects in Figma.


üß† How does it work?

There are two ways to trigger your export settings to be applied. The first is a window giving you UI access to run the plugin commands. (Set Platform, Apply Settings, Clear Settings)

The second is via the plugin menu; this makes the actions searchable in Figma with the `‚åò+/` command.


üîß Currently supported:

‚Ä¢ IOS

‚Ä¢ IOS Adv.

‚Ä¢ Android

‚Ä¢ Android Adv.

‚Ä¢ Web


üì¶ Export Options


‚ú® Export Settings

With Lazy export, you have two mobile options on how you can apply export settings.


‚Ä¢ Default Export

‚Ä¢ Advanced Export


With the default export, this follows the trends for exporting assets for mobile at the different screen densities. Advanced is still being worked on for a smooth workflow.


‚ÑπÔ∏è The end goal for Advanced Export Options, would be for a developer to hit apply, and Figma exports a folder of assets the developer can drop into Android Studio or Xcode.


Android Suffix

`drawable-mdpi`


IOS Suffix

`/default-asset@1x`


Android Advance Suffix

`/drawable-mdpi/default-asset`


IOS Advance Suffix

`/default-asset.imageset/default-asset@1x`


‚úçÔ∏è Custom Asset Naming


Right now, if you do not apply a custom name to each asset, a default one will be used.

üìÜ I have plans on the roadmap to adjust this.


Default Name String = `default-asset`


üêõ Have a feature request or bug? Please feel free to add an issue!

Development, issues, and feature requests https://github.com/kocheck/Lazy-Export

accepted.description: üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Nerdü´Ä Husband, & Dad ‚ú® Product designer ü§ì stack overflow dev ‚ù§Ô∏è Design Systems & Design Tools

plugins.name: Text Porter
plugins.description:
Quickly Export and Import CSV Copy Decks


Looking for an easy way to manage copy decks in your product design process? Text Porter might be what you are after.


Text Porter will generate a CSV file containing text element labels, text and the root frame name. The plugin will also export PNG's of all the root frames for reference when providing to copywriters outside of Figma.


Exclusion options allow you to choose which text elements you would like to have exported by Text Porter.


Supports updating both text and name of text elements.


How To Use


  1. Select your frames containing the UX copy you would like to export
  2. Run the Text Porter plugin and click the "Export" button to generate a zip file containing a CSV file and reference images
  3. Send the zip to your copywriter and have them make the copy updates in the "Text" column and return the updated CSV file (Do not edit the ID column, this is used for the import process)
  4. Run the Text Porter plugin and click the "Import" button and selected the updated CSV file
  5. Watch all the text element update with your new copy changes
  6. Profit


Notes:

  • Does not play well with mixed styles. Will replace with initial style used in mixed style element.
  • If you are using Microsoft Excel, you have to import the CSV data and ensure when you select the file origin, it is set to Unicode (UTF-8)


Love Text Porter? Buy me a coffee ü§©

accepted.name: Kirk Bentley
accepted.description:
Pixel pusher & Tiger herder

Love my resources?
Buy me a coffee:  https://www.buymeacoffee.com/kirkbentley

plugins.name: Flutter Constant Generator
plugins.description:
The "Figma to Flutter Constants" plugin is a powerful tool for developers working with Flutter and Figma. It allows users to quickly and easily generate constant classes for colors and text styles, directly from their Figma designs. The plugin is designed to make the process of integrating design into code as seamless as possible.

One of the key features of the plugin is its ability to generate responsive text styles. Users can specify font weights or use default weights to ensure that the text styles they create will adapt to different screen sizes and resolutions. Additionally, the only requirement for using the plugin is that the Figma files have defined color styles and text styles. This makes it easy for developers to start using the plugin right away, without needing to spend time formatting their Figma files.

plugins.name: Catalog
plugins.description:
What the plugin can do:

  • Create a directory of your scripts (sections).
  • Move quickly to the desired section.
  • Search by sections.
  • Number sections and frames automatically.
  • It is convenient to track dates, statuses of tasks and designers.


How the plugin works:

  1. On first run, the plugin creates a component ‚ùñ catalog.
  2. You place instances (copies) of this component next to logical partitions, building a hierarchy, you have 3 types of headers H1, H2, H3 at your disposal.
  3. Then you can name the sections, for this there is a special text field "title" inside the component.
  4. Scan the page.
  5. A directory will be generated.
  6. Then you can number the entire directory.

plugins.name: A Toolkit
plugins.description:
üéâ My new plugin, Component Crafter, is now live! You're all welcome to try it out! üëâ LINK


-----------------------------------------------------


This powerful plugin boosts design efficiency, eliminates repetitive tasks, and lets you focus fully on creativity and innovation. and support 20 languages.


2025.05.28 Change log

ui optimization


Tutorial link

https://youtu.be/vrik6pKBc20?si=7NKhtP4-aG4H28Li


Select Panel

Scenario: Working in a complex interface with multiple similar buttons or icons. The selection panel quickly identifies all layers with the same attributes (e.g., position, size, color), making unified adjustments more convenient.

Usage Example: Select a button, and the plugin automatically matches all buttons with the same color or style ID. This allows designers to modify styles in bulk, ensuring consistency.


Find and Replace Panel

Scenario: Modify text or layer names within a specific range, such as elements on a particular page or within a selected layer group.

Usage Example: Ideal for large projects, this feature helps designers make quick and accurate local edits, avoiding the confusion caused by global replacements.


Locator Panel

Scenario: Large projects often involve numerous layers, making it easy to lose track of specific ones.

Usage Example: Save important layers (e.g., logos or specific versions) to the locator panel with tags and descriptions. Quickly find them later by clicking the tags, boosting efficiency.


Frame Resize Panel

Scenario: Resize multiple layers to meet design specifications, such as scaling components from a 9-grid layout to specific dimensions.

Usage Example: Select a button and set a scaling ratio. The plugin automatically adjusts layer sizes according to 9-grid rules and saves presets for quick reuse.


Export Panel

Scenario: Export multiple layers as image files, particularly in projects with many icons or slices.

Usage Example: Use the export panel to select layers starting with "ic" or "icon." The plugin exports these layers automatically, applying predefined export options, multipliers, and platform settings (iOS, Android, Web) for seamless slicing.


Tips to use

1Ôºöreplace panel search then click keyboard ‚Üê and ‚Üí to switch next and previous layer


2:select panel right click the item menuÔºåyou will find some new features

plugins.name: Column width generator - Auto layout helper
plugins.description:
üåü Introducing Column width generator


üìä Design Precision:

Craft pixel-perfect columns of various widths effortlessly.


üîÑ Seamless Edits:

Your design evolves, and so does our plugin ‚Äì automatic resizing at its best!


üé® Tailored for Figma Enthusiasts:

Perfect for both seasoned pros and design newcomers.


üí° Unleash Your Creativity:

Our plugin empowers you to focus on what truly matters ‚Äì your design vision.


How it works

  1. Select one or more items within a frame with autolayout enabled
  2. It uses the gap from the autolayout frame so no need for extra inputs
  3. Select the amount of columns you want the item to be and click
  4. Watch your item(s) get the width of the selected amount of columns.


Nice to know!

  1. The plugin has a minimize function so you can easily leave the plugin open without it taking up a lot of space.
  2. You can select you own amount of columns, it is only default to 12 because that is THE design standard.
  3. You can also use it calculate percentage very easily. It's basicly 4 / 12 -> 33.33... %, 3 / 12 -> 25% etc.


Want to buy me a coffee?

To help as many people as possible I will keep my plugins completely free. But if my plugin helped you and you want to buy me a coffee you can do that here: https://buymeacoffee.com/sven.figma
plugins.tagline: Create complex layouts within seconds all lined up to the grid of your choice!

plugins.name: Json Exporter
plugins.description:
Exports figma data as a single json document with as much as possible of the internal figma data left as-is. The purpose of this plugin is act as a data dump for further processing externally.


The code is open source and is available on github, where you can also find more details on the exported data structure: https://github.com/kasper573/figma-plugin-raw-json-exporter.


If you are using Typescript, you may also be interested in https://github.com/kasper573/figma-to-typescript, which uses the json exported from this plugin to generate a Typescript representation of your design tokens.

plugins.name: Titleitos note
plugins.description:
Titleitos: note (Small)


Create titles and comments with a click of a button.

It's that simple.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select Titleitos from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a titleito!


If you select an Object / Frame and use the Titleitos plugin, the title will appear above on the y axis. If not, it will just float on your screen for fast use.


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  1. Go to System Preferences
  2. Search for Keyboard
  3. Click on Shortcuts tab
  4. Search for "App Shortcuts"
  5. Add Figma.app
  6. Click on the + and Type in: "Titleitos note"
  7. Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+.
  8. That's it!


Enjoy!


(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)

plugins.name: Spreadsheet to Charts - Easy, No Fuss, Word Cloud
plugins.description:
Spreadsheet to Charts helps you generate Bar Charts, Pie Charts and Wordclouds based on rows and columns on a spreadsheet survey (.xlsx or .xls from Google Sheets or Excel).


With this tool, you can:

  1. Automatically generate charts from spreadsheet.
  2. Select from 3 types of charts. (Bar, Pie, Wordcloud)
  3. Edit those generated charts as Shapes and Texts.


Spreadsheet to Charts is meant to help Designers and Product Managers quickly generate charts needed for research data visualisation, to even preparing research pitches.


How to use:

  1. Open plugin on Figma or Figjam.
  2. Locate .xlsx or .xls file on plugin.
  3. Choose type of chart.
  4. Check conditions (labels, axis, legends)
  5. Generate Charts.


by Yuan Jie

plugins.name: Bulk Style Swap
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to swap any styles used in the current page or selection with a specified local counterpart, using JSON input.


{ 
  "old-style-name": "new-style-name"
}


  • Get styles from page / selection - this will automatically extract all styles currently used and generate an initial JSON tree. Then you need to add the new style names to replace the old ones.
  • Swap styles on page / selection - this will then apply the replacement styles.

plugins.name: Localizely
plugins.description:
Design multilingual apps easier than ever. Connect Figma with Localizely, and improve your designing experience on the go. 


What Figma + Localizely plugin does? 


It helps you create efficient and effective collaboration between your designers, translators, and product manager.


How‚Äôs that helping you?


With this plugin, you‚Äôre able to send any texts inside design from Figma to Localizely to get them translated. 


You can also pull the translated texts back to Figma - in the existing design preview, or create a new one. 


All this within a few clicks. No manual entry. 


This way you can easily preview and translate text in designs, and improve while the process is in the progress. 


How to use it?


You‚Äôll need to have accounts on Figma and Localizely.


1. Open your Figma project

2. Go to the Plugins section and choose Localizely

3. Connect your Localizely account

4. Select your Localizely project

5. Click Finish Setup.



For detailed instructions please check the documentation.

*Please note that you can try out this plugin for free, but after a trial period you‚Äôll need a paid plan to use it. 


You don‚Äôt have a Localizely account?

Don‚Äôt worry, you can sign up quickly, and run it for free for small projects.


What is Localizely anyway?

Localizely is a translation management tool that'll simplify your workflow during software localization.

accepted.description: Localizely is a Translation management platform for multilingual apps

plugins.tagline: Design multilingual apps easier than ever

plugins.name: Brutal
plugins.description:
Any action will affect your currently selected layers


> Remove All

  1. Remove all colors
  2. This will leave only transparent layers/frames/texts/paths...


> Remove Styles

  1. Remove all color styles
  2. Color variables and custom colors remain untouched


> Remove Variables

  1. Remove all color variables
  2. Color styles and custom colors remain untouched


> Remove custom colors

  1. Remove all colors which are not applied as styles or variables


> Detach styles

  1. Detaches color styles
  2. Layers will keep the color(s)


> Detach variables

  1. Detaches color variables
  2. Layers will keep the color(s)


> Replace styles, variables and custom colors

  1. Afterwards every previously colored layer will have the same color applied to there strokes and fills
  2. Effects will be removed


Options:

> Replace styles on..

Choose if you like to preserve selected layers and remove only styles of it's child layers


> Preserve layers by name

Layers with a name matching your input won't be touched.


> Preserve nested layers

Leaves also child layers untouched


It's Brutal, it's free. Enjoy!


Known limitations:

Brutal can't remove/replace strokes from sections.
plugins.tagline: Quickly remove styles, fills, strokes, effects from your current selection.

plugins.name: AI Logo & Design Generator
plugins.description:
AI Logo & Design Generator is a Figma plugin that helps you create logos, illustrations, and graphics using artificial intelligence. The tool is built to assist designers, entrepreneurs, and creative professionals who need visual assets quickly.


The plugin works directly within your Figma workspace, allowing you to generate design and graphic elements based on text prompts and style preferences. You can create initial concepts for logos, produce custom illustrations.


You can also use this tool for converting raster images to SVG format. Which helps you trace bitmap images(png,jpg..) to vector image(svg) in both color or black & white so that you can scale the image infinitely without loosing the quality.


You get to try for free with 12 credits upon signing up, After that you can purchase credits that never expire, no hassle of subscription.


Ideal for initial concept exploration, rapid prototyping, or creating assets when you're facing tight deadlines or budget constraints.
